utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Chandler is playing foosball by himself, Joey enters]

utterances.transcript: Hey.
Hey. Hold on a second. Huh?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hey. Hold on a second. [shoots a goal] Huh?

utterances.transcript: Nice, nice. Hey I got somethin' for you. [hands Chandler an envelope.
What's this?
Eight hundred and twelve bucks.
Well, I don't know what Big Leon told ya but it's an even thousand if you want me for the whole night. What is this for?
Well, I'm makin money now and this is payin' you back for head shots, electric bills, and so many slices of pizza I can't even count. I love ya man.
Well, thanks man. Now I can get my pony.
Hey, this is a little extra somethin' for uh, ya know, always bein' there for me.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hey, this is a little extra somethin' for uh, ya know, always bein' there for me. [hands Chandler a jewelry box]

utterances.transcript: Wow, I don't know what to say. Wow, I, I don't know what to say.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Wow, I don't know what to say. [opens the box and pulls out an incredibly gaudy gold bracelet] Wow, I, I don't know what to say.

utterances.transcript: Heh, what d'ya say?
I don't know. It's a bracelet.
Isn't it? And it's engraved too, check it out.
To my best bud. Thanks best bud.
utterances.transcript_with_note: [reads] To my best bud. [puts it back in the case] Thanks best bud.

utterances.transcript: Put it on.
Oh, now? No, no, I think something this nice should be saved for a special occasion.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, now? [puts it in his desk drawer] No, no, I think something this nice should be saved for a special occasion. [sets a chair in front of the drawer]

utterances.transcript: Oh, no no, that's the beauty part, it goes with everything. You put this on, you're good to go. Ohhh man, you are so wearin' that bracelet.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, no no, that's the beauty part, it goes with everything. [gets the bracelet from the drawer] You put this on, you're good to go. [puts the bracelet on Chandler] Ohhh man, you are so wearin' that bracelet.

utterances.transcript: I so am.
You have any idea what this'll do for your sex life?
Well, it'll probably slow it down at first but, once I get used to the extra weight, I'll be back on track.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: A kitchen somewhere. Monica is interviewing for a job]

utterances.transcript: Well, this all looks good.
Great.
And if I want to call for a reference on your last job?
Oh, that's there on the bottom, see the manager, Chandler Bing.
Alright, lets see if you're as good in person as you are on paper. Make me a salad.
A salad? Really I, I could do something a little more complicated if you like.
No, just a salad will be fine.
You got it.
Now, I want you to tell me what you're doing while you're doing it.
Alright, well I'm tearing the lettuce.
Uh-huh. Is it dirty?
Oh-oh, no no don't worry, I'm gonna wash it.
Don't, I like it dirty.
That's your call.
So, uh, what are you going to do next?
Well, I thought that I would cut up the tomatos.
Are they, uh, firm?
They'r alright.
You sure they haven't gone bad? You're sure they're not very, very bad?
No really, they're OK.
You gonna slice them up real nice?
Actually, I was gonna do them jullienne.
Aaaahhhhhhh.
I'm outa here.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I'm outa here. [Monica leaves]

utterances.transcript: Hi.

Hi darling.

Oh, God forbid.

utterances.transcript: Oh, hi Rachel.
Hi.
Oh, we were so sorry to hear about your parents splitting up, dear.
Oh, well, you know, they're just separated so, you know, never know, we'll see.

What, what incident?
Uhh, naa, no no no, I, I must be thinking of someone else, uh, maybe me. Don't you have some folding to do? Go fold dear. Fold. You fold.

You know what, you guys, we don't have to watch this.
Oh yeah we do. C'mon.
Get a shot of Monica. Where's Monica.
Over here dad.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Over here dad. [he pans over and we see a torso taking up the whole screen]

utterances.transcript: Wait, how do you zoom out? There she is.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Wait, how do you zoom out? [zooms out and we see an extremely overweight Monica eating a big sandwich] There she is.

utterances.transcript: Some girl ate Monica.
Shut up, the camera adds ten pounds.
Ahh, so how many cameras are actually on you?
Oh, you look so great.
Ahh, so do you, beautiful.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ahh, so do you, beautiful. [they hug]

utterances.transcript: Oops.
What?
Shoot, I think I got mayonaise on you.
Oh, that's OK, it's just the shoulder, it's not my dress.
Everybody smile.
Oh, dad, turn it off.
It is off.
Dad, it is not. What's with the red light?
It's the off light. Right Ross?
utterances.transcript_with_note: It's the off light. Right Ross? [pans over to see Ross with an afro and moustache]

utterances.transcript: Lookin' good Mr. Cotter.
You look pretty tonight.
Oh, thanks. So, uh, what are you gonna do this summer?
Oh, you know, I'm just gonna, I'm gonna hang out, work on my music.
Is my hook unhooked? These things keep falling down, I can't. . .
utterances.transcript_with_note: [the shoulders of her dress keep falling off her shoulders] Is my hook unhooked? These things keep falling down, I can't. . .

utterances.transcript: Uh, hold, let me see, I don't know. So what're you gonna do. . .
utterances.transcript_with_note: Uh, hold, let me see, I don't know. So what're you gonna do. . . [doorbell rings]

utterances.transcript: Oh, the guys are here.
this summer?
Work on your music?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Work on your music? [Ross is sitting on the stairs with a laptop keyboard playing 'Axel-F']

utterances.transcript: Oh my God, look there's Roy Gublik.
Ya know, Roy saw Star Wars 317 times. His name was in the paper.
Where's Chip, why isn't he here yet?
He'll be here OK, take a chill pill.
utterances.transcript_with_note: He'll be here OK, take a chill pill. [Chip pins Monica's corsage on, Monica then turns and whispers to Rachel]

utterances.transcript: I just told Rachel that Roy touched my boob.
I can't go to my own prom without a date, I can't, it's too late.
If you're not going then I don't want to go either.
Oh, I'm gonna kick Chip's ass.
I have a wonderful idea. You should take Rachel to the prom.
utterances.transcript_with_note: [to Ross on the stairs] I have a wonderful idea. You should take Rachel to the prom.

utterances.transcript: Doubtful.
Jack, give me that. Talk to your son.
Your mother's right. Take her, you can wear my tux.
Dad, she won't want to go with me.
Of course she would, you're a college man.
I don't know.
Well, c'mon. Don't ya want to find out?
I can't believe I don't get to go to my own prom, this is so harsh.
OK. Hold my board.
Atta boy.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Atta boy. [Ross scrambles upstairs to change]

utterances.transcript: OK, you guys, ya know, I think we've seen enough, let's turn it off.
No, no, no.
OK, fine, well I'm not gonna watch, alright.
C'mon kid, let's go.
Ahh, are you hadsome.
Let's show 'em.
Uh, just a sec dad. OK, be cool, just be cool. OK dad.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Uh, just a sec dad. [to himself] OK, be cool, just be cool. [walks down the stairs and grabs the flowers out of the vase on the endtable] OK dad.

utterances.transcript: Rachel, ready or not, here comes your knight in shining. . . oh no.
utterances.transcript_with_note: [going downstairs] Rachel, ready or not, here comes your knight in shining. . . oh no. [Chip has shown up and the four are leaving]

utterances.transcript: Bye.
Oh, dear. Jack, how do I turn this off?
Press the button.
Which one? Which button, Jack.
The button, the button.
I can't believe you did that.
Yeah, well.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, well. [Rachel, seeing what he did for her, gets up, walks across the room, and kisses Ross]

utterances.transcript: See, he's her lobster.

utterances.transcript: Dance with him.
Mom, I'm hungry.
Dance with your father.
I may not know any of your flash dances but I'm no slouch on the dance floor.
Alright.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Alright. [the tape cuts to Monica's parents under the covers]

utterances.transcript: Oh, Jack.
Oh, Judy. Oh, Judy.
Oh, ohhhhh.

plots: Monica discovers some unexpected footage of monica 's parents at the end of the video tape .
During the end credits , Monica finishes watching the tape , and inadvertently finds a recording of Jack and Judy having sex .
